sentence: 3 |||  ||| 0.3 ||| Hypothesis: Telmisartan may be more effective than amlodipine in preventing AF recurrence in hypertensive patients with paroxysmal AF and normal or increased left atrial dimension (LAD).
content: Telmisartan may be more effective than amlodipine in preventing AF recurrence in hypertensive patients with paroxysmal AF and normal or increased left atrial dimension (LAD)
label: pr.SS

sentence: 20 ||| Methods ||| 2.2 ||| Between October 1, 2009 andNovember 30, 2011, the study population was selected according to the following criteria: consecutive outpatients of either sex, age 40-80 years, with stage I hypertension (systolic blood pressure [SBP] ≥140 mm Hg and <160 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure [DBP] ≥90 mm Hg and <100 mm Hg), in sinus rhythm, but with ≥2 electrocardiogram (ECG)-documented episodes of symptomatic AF in the previous 6 months, each lasting >60 minutes but <7 days and terminating spontaneously.
label: po.Age

sentence: 20 ||| Methods ||| 2.2 ||| Between October 1, 2009 andNovember 30, 2011, the study population was selected according to the following criteria: consecutive outpatients of either sex, age 40-80 years, with stage I hypertension (systolic blood pressure [SBP] ≥140 mm Hg and <160 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure [DBP] ≥90 mm Hg and <100 mm Hg), in sinus rhythm, but with ≥2 electrocardiogram (ECG)-documented episodes of symptomatic AF in the previous 6 months, each lasting >60 minutes but <7 days and terminating spontaneously.
content: with stage I hypertension (systolic blood pressure [SBP] ≥140 mm Hg and <160 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure [DBP] ≥90 mm Hg and <100 mm Hg), in sinus rhythm, but with ≥2 electrocardiogram (ECG)-documented episodes of symptomatic AF in the previous 6 months, each lasting >60 minutes but <7 days and terminating spontaneously
label: po.SS

sentence: 35 ||| Methods ||| 2.17 ||| Palpitations were not taken into consideration, nor were patients' subjective appraisals.
label: po.SS

sentence: 4 |||  ||| 0.4 ||| Methods: The authors assigned 378 mild hypertensive outpatients in sinus rhythm, but with ≥2 episodes of AF in the previous 6 months, to 1 of 2 groups.
content: assigned 378 mild hypertensive outpatients in sinus rhythm
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 7 |||  ||| 0.7 ||| In both groups, patients were randomly treated with telmisartan or amlodipine for 1 year.
content: randomly treated with telmisartan or amlodipine for 1 year
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 36 ||| Methods ||| 2.18 ||| The primary endpoint of the study was to assess the efficacy of telmisartan as compared with amlodipine with regard to cumulative number of patients relapsing into documented AF.
content: assess the efficacy of telmisartan as compared with amlodipine with regard to cumulative number of patients relapsing into documented AF
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 37 ||| Methods ||| 2.19 ||| The secondary endpoint was the time to a first ECG-documented recurrence of AF.
content: the time to a first ECG-documented recurrence of AF
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 60 ||| Discussion ||| 5.2 ||| The first is that in hypertensive patients with a history of paroxysmal AF, antihypertensive treatment with the ARB telmisartan was more effective than amlodipine therapy in reducing AF recurrence, despite a similar BP reduction.
content: with the ARB telmisartan was more effective than amlodipine therapy in reducing AF recurrence
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 62 ||| Discussion ||| 5.4 ||| These results, which confirm some previous observation with this and other ARBs, 18 -23 are not in agreement with those of 2 large secondary prevention studies, the Gruppo Italiano per lo Studio della Sopravvivenza nell'Insufficienza Cardiaca (GISSI)-AF study 25 and the Angiotensin II-Antagonist in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation (ANTIPAF) trial, 26 which failed to demonstrate the efficacy of valsartan and olmesartan, respectively, in preventing AF recurrence.
content: the Gruppo Italiano per lo Studio della Sopravvivenza nell'Insufficienza Cardiaca (GISSI)-AF study 25 and the Angiotensin II-Antagonist in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation (ANTIPAF) trial, 26 which failed to demonstrate the efficacy of valsartan and olmesartan, respectively, in preventing AF recurrence
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 70 ||| Discussion ||| 5.12 ||| Finally, the different pharmacologic characteristics of the ARBs used also might have played a role; telmisartan has been shown to have the strongest binding affinity to Ang II type 1 receptors among various ARBs, the rank order of affinity being telmisartan > olmesartan > candesartan > valsartan > losartan.
content: the rank order of affinity being telmisartan > olmesartan > candesartan > valsartan > losartan
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 71 ||| Discussion ||| 5.13 ||| Also, the selective peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor-gamma-modulating activity, which is peculiar to telmisartan, 28 -31 might contribute to its AF-preventive effect, through the insulin-sensitizing effect and the attenuation of AF-promoting atrial remodeling related to peroxisome proliferator-activated receptorgamma stimulation.
content: 28 -31 might contribute to its AF-preventive effect
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 66 ||| Discussion ||| 5.8 ||| Furthermore, the proportion of patients with coronary heart disease was higher in the valsartan group than in the placebo group, as was the proportion of patients with pathologic Q-wave and with peripheral artery disease, so that patients in the valsartan group were more complicated and prone to AF development.
content: the proportion of patients with coronary heart disease was higher in the valsartan group than in the placebo group, as was the proportion of patients with pathologic Q-wave and with peripheral artery disease
label: o.Patient
